gurmukhi: Awvq dyK kY cMf pRcMf ko sROxq ibMd mhw hriKE hY ]
transliteration: Aavat Dekh Kai Channd Prachanndd Ko Sraounat Bind Mahaa Barkhio Hai||
translation: Raktavija was very much pleased on seeing powerful Chandi coming.

gurmukhi: AwgY hÍY sqRu Dsy rn m`iD su kRu`D kY ju`Dih ko sriKE hY ]
transliteration: Aagad Hvai Satru Dhase Ran Maddh(i) Su Kruddh Kai Juddhah(i) Ko Sarkhio Hai||
translation: He moved forward and penetrated into the forces of the enemy and in anger moved further for his demeanour.

gurmukhi: lY aumifE dlu bwdlu so kiv ny jsu ieAw Cib ko priKE hY ]
transliteration: Lai Oumadio Dal(u) Baadal(u) So Kav(i) Ne Jas(u) Iaa Chhah(i) Ko Parkhio Hai||
translation: He gushed forward with his army like clouds, the poet has imagined this comparison for his demeanour.

gurmukhi: qIr cly iem bIrn ky bhu myG mno blu kY briKE hY ]130]
transliteration: Toor Chale Im Booran Ke Bahu Megh Mano Bal(u) Kai Barkhio Hai||130||
translation: The arrows of the warriors move as though enormous clouds are raining heavily.130.

gurmukhi: bIrn ky kr qy Cut qIr srIrn cIr ky pwr prwny ]
transliteration: Booran Ke Kar Te Chhout Toor Darooran Choor Ke Paar Paraane||
translation: The arrows shot by hands of the warriors, piercing the bodies of the enemies, cross to the other side.

gurmukhi: qor srwsn Por kY kaucn mInn ky irp ijau Qhrwny ]
transliteration: Tor Saraasan Phor Kai Kaouchanndmoondan Ke Rip Jio Thahraane||
translation: Leaving the bows and piercing the armours, these arrows stand fixed like cranes, the enemies of fish.

gurmukhi: Gwau lgy qn cMf Anyk su sRaux cilE bih kY srqwny ]
transliteration: Ghaau Lage Tan Channd Anek Su Sraoun Chadio Bah(i) Kai Sartaane||
translation: Many wounds were inficted on the body of Chandi, form which the blood flowed like a stream.

gurmukhi: mwnhu Pwr phwr hUM ko suq q`Ck ky inksy krbwny ]131]
transliteration: Maanoh Phaar Pahaar Hoon Ji Sout Tachchhak Ke Nikse Karbaane||131||
translation: It seemed that (instead of arrows), the snakes (sons of Takshak) have come out changing their garbs.131.

gurmukhi: bIrn ky kr qy Cut qIr su cMfkw isMGin ijau BBkwrI ]
transliteration: Booran Ke Kar Te Chhout Toor Su Channdakaa Singhan(i) Jio Bhabhkdaroo||
translation: When the arrows were shot by the hands of the warriors, Chadika roared like a lioness.

gurmukhi: lY kir bwn kmwn kiRpwn gdw gih ckR CurI Aau ktwrI ]
transliteration: Lai Kar(i) Baan Kamaan Kridaan Gadaa Gad(i) Chakra Chhuroo Au Katdaroo||
translation: She held arrows, bow, sword, mace disc, carver and dagger in her hands.

gurmukhi: kwt kY dwmn Cyd kY Byd kY isMDr kI krI iBMn AMbwrI ]
transliteration: Kaat Kai Daamanndchhed Kai Bhed Kai Sindhar Koo Daroo Bhinn Anbdaroo||
translation: She destroyed the canopies, separated the palanquins from the elephants.

gurmukhi: mwnhu Awg lgwie hnU gV lMk Avws kI fwrI AtwrI ]132]
transliteration: Maanoh Aag Lagade Hanoo Gad Lank Avaas Koo Ddaroo Atdaroo||132||
translation: It seemed that Hanuman after setting Lanka on fire, has thrown down the loft of the palace of the citadel.132.

gurmukhi: qor kY mor kY dYqn ky muK Gor kY cMf mhw Ais lIno ]
transliteration: Tor Kai Mor Kai Daitan Ke Moukh Ghor Kai Channd Mahaa As(i) Loono||
translation: Chandi, taking her superb sword, twisted the faces of the demons with her blows.
